intro: Phaeneilema diversifolium, commonly known as the variable-leaved phaeneilema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which can range from lanceolate to ovate, depending on the habitat. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, often displaying a mix of white and green hues. The species is noted for its adaptability to varying environmental conditions, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
